recommendations.reasoning: As the priority is 'COSTS', us-east1 is chosen for its zero transfer cost ($0/year), making it the most cost-effective region. Alternative regions like northamerica-northeast1 and europe-north2 incur significantly higher annual costs ($292/year and $730/year, respectively). While these regions offer lower emissions (saving up to 1.467 kg CO2/year compared to us-east1), the cost to avoid these emissions (e.g., $204.62/kg CO2 for northamerica-northeast1 and $497.56/kg CO2 for europe-north2) is prohibitively high and not justified under a strict cost minimization strategy. This specific time slot is prioritized as it presents the 1st lowest carbon intensity (601 gCO2eq/kWh) within the cost-optimal us-east1 region.
